Format powers of ten

Richard Layton

2022-11-13

Source: vignettes/format_powers_of_ten.Rmd
format_powers_of_ten.Rmd
library("formatdown")
library("data.table")

Scalar value.

format_power(101100)
#> [1] "$101\\times10^{3}$"

In an Rmarkdown document:

  • \(101\times10^{3}\)

Vector value.

x <- c(1.2222e-6, 2.3333e-5, 3.4444e-4, 4.1111e-3, 5.2222e-2, 6.3333e-1,
       7.4444e+0, 8.1111e+1, 9.2222e+2, 1.3333e+3, 2.4444e+4, 3.1111e+5, 4.2222e+6)
format_power(x)
#>  [1] "$1.22\\times10^{-6}$" "$23.3\\times10^{-6}$" "$344\\times10^{-6}$" 
#>  [4] "$4.11\\times10^{-3}$" "$52.2\\times10^{-3}$" "$0.633$"             
#>  [7] "$7.44$"               "$81.1$"               "$922$"               
#> [10] "$1.33\\times10^{3}$"  "$24.4\\times10^{3}$"  "$311\\times10^{3}$"  
#> [13] "$4.22\\times10^{6}$"

In an Rmarkdown document:

  • \(1.22\times10^{-6}\), \(23.3\times10^{-6}\), \(344\times10^{-6}\), etc.

Significant digits argument.

format_power(x[1], 3)
#> [1] "$1.22\\times10^{-6}$"

format_power(x[1], 4)
#> [1] "$1.222\\times10^{-6}$"

In an Rmarkdown document:

  • \(1.22\times10^{-6}\)
  • \(1.222\times10^{-6}\)

Engineering notation argument.

format_power(x[3], engr_notation = TRUE)
#> [1] "$344\\times10^{-6}$"

format_power(x[3], engr_notation = FALSE)
#> [1] "$3.44\\times10^{-4}$"

In an Rmarkdown document:

  • \(344\times10^{-6}\)
  • \(3.44\times10^{-4}\)

Changing the limits on range for disabling exponential notation.

format_power(x[6], disable_exponent = c(0.1, 1000))
#> [1] "$0.633$"

format_power(x[6], disable_exponent = c(1, 1000))
#> [1] "$633\\times10^{-3}$"

In an Rmarkdown document:

  • \(0.633\)
  • \(633\times10^{-3}\)

Apply to numerical columns of a data frame (using data.table syntax).

DT <- data.table(y = x[1:6], z = x[8:13])
DT <- DT[, lapply(.SD, function(x) format_power(x))]
DT[]
#>                       y                   z
#> 1: $1.22\\times10^{-6}$              $81.1$
#> 2: $23.3\\times10^{-6}$               $922$
#> 3:  $344\\times10^{-6}$ $1.33\\times10^{3}$
#> 4: $4.11\\times10^{-3}$ $24.4\\times10^{3}$
#> 5: $52.2\\times10^{-3}$  $311\\times10^{3}$
#> 6:              $0.633$ $4.22\\times10^{6}$

In an Rmarkdown document (with knitr::kable()):

knitr::kable(DT, align = "r")
y z
\(1.22\times10^{-6}\) \(81.1\)
\(23.3\times10^{-6}\) \(922\)
\(344\times10^{-6}\) \(1.33\times10^{3}\)
\(4.11\times10^{-3}\) \(24.4\times10^{3}\)
\(52.2\times10^{-3}\) \(311\times10^{3}\)
\(0.633\) \(4.22\times10^{6}\)
